Also thinking perhaps some sort of camera should be built into the game (unless we get a ground radar to shows distance and ideally inclination), because if we want to fly start to end without ever leaving the cockpit, landing is going to be pretty much impossible without using an autopilot that does know where the ground is. Or we are going to have to get more creative in our landers so that the windows face down (which would actually be a fantastic way to land).

You still wouldn't be able to do that all the time. For example in atmospheric craft, You need access to parts right-click menus. And AFAIK, it only works from outside (I base this on the fact that there were no indicators of specific parts in cockpit view so far)...

I don't think transitions from IVA to EVA are technically possible (right now), because the IVA doesn't take place inside your rocket. Instead, I think they said it is using its own worldspace or something, where as the EVA creates a new ship inside the normal world space. For a transition to work, the interiors would have to be part of the 3rd person rocket itself (hollow, but with modeled interiors that the kerbal ships could navigate). If they were ever going to do this, I imagine the rockets would need to be made much larger than they are now to accommodate the details (of course they could just scale the entire world and we would never notice).

Are there any pictures of Moho somewhere, or have any such pictures not been released yet?

The reason the old Mk1 pod was put out of service was because all the part sizes had to be redone in order for rockets to make more proportional sense to how big the Kerbals actually are.
